channel.title: Humanitarian Program on AFUO - СУОА
channel.description: Recent content in Humanitarian Program on AFUO - СУОА

item.title: Ukraine Crisis Appeal: Your money at work - 1st stage report.
item.description: The is the first stage funding report from the Ukraine Crisis Appeal committee. You can read the whole report by clicking here. This report includes detail about the Ukrainians who were helped. _Background for the first stage of funding: _ In 2018, $128,000 AUD was raised by the fund. This enabled the Veteran Program to support 25 Veterans and their families (approximately 100 people) on the journey for a better life.

item.title: Development of OT in Ukraine is now apart of the Ukrainian Crisis Аppeal
item.description: A few months ago, we introduced you to Kirrily Manning, an Australian Occupational Therapist (OT) playing a key role working to develop the OT profession in Ukraine. You can read more about her story here in English and here in Ukrainian. Throughout the years that Go Global, Ukraine ran at Curtin University (2009-2013) led by Kirrily, over 70 students from occupational therapy, speech therapy, physiotherapy and nutrition travelled to Ukraine.
